tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: in the tenth month, and on the tenth day of the month
tn.text: This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is near the end of December on Western calendars. This is during the cold season when there may be rain and snow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: came with all his army against Jerusalem
tn.text: The name "Jerusalem" is a metonym for the people who lived in it. AT: "came with his whole army to fight against the people of Jerusalem" or "came with his whole army to conquer Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the ninth day of the fourth month
tn.text: This is the fourth month of the Hebrew calendar. The ninth day is near the end of June on Western calendars. This is during the dry season when there is very little or no rain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are the inhabitants of Jerusalem, including refugees from the surrounding villages that fled to Jerusalem when the war started.

tn.ref: Then the city was broken into
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Then the Babylonian army broke into the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"all the warriors"

tn.ref: by the way of the gate
tn.text: "by using the gate"
Some translations use "Chaldeans" and others use "Babylonians." Both terms refer to the same people group.

tn.ref: The king went in the direction of
tn.text: "King Zedekiah also fled and he went toward"

tn.ref: All his army was scattered away from him
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "His whole army ran away from him" or "The Chaldeans chased away his whole army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"decided how they would punish him" (see UDB)

tn.ref: they slaughtered them before his eyes
tn.text: The eyes are synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "they forced king Zedekiah to watch them kill his sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

"Nebuchadnezzar put out Zedekiah's eyes." It might be best to translate so that the reader understands that other people might have helped Nebuchadnezzar do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month
tn.text: This is the fifth month of the Hebrew calendar. The seventh day is near the end of July on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This is the ordinal form of the number 19. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: As for all the walls around Jerusalem, all
tn.text: "This is what happened to all the walls around Jerusalem: all"
"who were following the orders of"

tn.ref: As for the rest of the people ... city, those
tn.text: "This is what happened to the rest of the people ... city: those"

tn.ref: the rest of the people who were left in the city
tn.text: "the people who remained in the city"
"left the city and gone to be with the king"

tn.ref: As for the bronze pillars ... Yahweh, the Chaldeans
tn.text: "This is what happened to the bronze pillars ... Yahweh: the Chaldeans"
This refers to the large, moveable bronze stands with bronze wheels and axles. "the moveable bronze stands" or "the bronze stands with wheels" (UDB)
"the large bronze basin"
"cut them into pieces" or "chopped them up into small pieces"
A shovel was a tool that was used to clean the altar, typically used to move big piles of dirt, sand, or ashes.

tn.ref: with which the priests had served in the temple
tn.text: "which the priests had used in the temple service"
You may need to make explicit which ashes are spoken of. AT: "The pots that were used for removing ashes from the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"the large bronze basin." Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:25:13|25:13]].
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:25:13|25:13]].
A cubit was 46 centimeters. AT: "about 8.3 meters ... about 1.4 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
"an artistic, bronze design" or "a bronze piece with designs"
This was a design made of crossed strips that looked like a net.
"completely made of bronze"
Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:25:08|25:8]].
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These words refer to Zephaniah. Another possible meaning is "the priest under Seraiah."
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:07:09|7:10]].
"captured and kept from escaping"

tn.ref: an officer who was in charge of soldiers
tn.text: Other translations may read "a eunuch who was in charge of soldiers." A eunuch is a man whose private parts have been removed.

tn.ref: officer responsible for drafting men into the army
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) the officer forced men to become soldiers or 2) the officer wrote down the names of the men who became soldiers.
This is the name of a man. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:25:08|25:8]].
This is the name of a place. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:25:06|25:6]].

This is a polite way of saying "killed them." It might be best to translate so that the reader understands that other people might have helped the king do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: In this way, Judah went out of its land into exile
tn.text: "So Judah was taken into exile out of its land"

tn.ref: Judah went out of its land
tn.text: Judah, the name of the people group, is a metonym for the people themselves. AT: "the people of Judah went out of their land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Gedaliah ... Ahikam ... Shaphan ... Ishmael ... Nethaniah ... Johanan ... Kareah ... Seraiah ... Tanhumeth ... Jaazaniah
tn.text: These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a descendant of a man named Netophah (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
from a place called Maacah (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This is the seventh month on the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of September and the first part of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This is the name of a man (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a generalization. AT: "many people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: from the least to the greatest
tn.text: This is a merism that means "everyone," which is a generalization. AT: "from the least important to the most important" or "everyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
seventh year** - (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month
tn.text: seventh day of the month** - This is the twelfth month of the Hebrew calendar. The twenty-seventh day is near the beginning of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
Merodach** - This is what the man's name sounded like, not a description of him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: a seat more honorable than that of the other kings
tn.text: Giving a good place at the dining table is a metonym for honoring him. AT: "more honor than the other kings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The reader should understand that removing his prison clothes is a synecdoche for making him a free man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"with the king and his officials"

tn.ref: A regular food allowance was given to him
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "The king made sure that he had a regular food allowance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"Money to buy food"
